[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 103]
Reasoning: **Analyzing card strategies**

I'm considering how to maximize the score by playing flushes of the same suit, aiming for that x1.5 multiplier per card. With splash, all cards count, which makes a five-card hand of all Clubs especially beneficial. Each Ancient triggers the multiplier, so I want to use them wisely. It seems logical to start with a strong card like the club ace. I’m weighing the likelihood of different hands, noting that pairs and flushes are the most probable outcomes.
**Choosing the best planet**

I’m contemplating if I need more chips or multipliers, but maybe an additional planet could increase reliability against higher antes. Earth improves my full house base level. While Splash encourages playing five cards for a flush, aiming for a full house gives a better base multiplier. Full houses typically have a solid base, plus they consist of three of a kind and a pair. Since only the highest hand counts, Earth looks like the best choice for upgrades!
**Understanding scoring in Balatro**

In Balatro, if I make a full house, all five cards score, which is interesting. With Splash, it looks like every played card counts toward scoring, even if they're not the highest hand. This means all played cards contribute chips and triggers, which is a huge advantage, especially with Ancients and the Scholar! I need to focus on playing five cards, potentially a flush, while also considering how raising the base hand type impacts overall chips and multipliers. A flush at level four already scores higher than a full house at level one!
**Comparing scoring potentials**

I see that a full house is currently lower than a flush, but it might catch up when leveled. At level two, it could score 65 chips and a multiplier of 6, while the flush stands at 80/10. The straight at level one scores 30/4, but leveling it seems to keep it lower as well. Four of a kind begins at 60/7, and leveling can bring it to 90/10. So, while Mars has potential for four of a kind with Aces, it's tough to achieve. I need to weigh the risks of picking Mars carefully.
**Weighing planet options**

I’m considering how to leverage four Aces for a four of a kind, which seems rare but possible. However, pair hands can yield high scores due to retriggering. My base multiplier for a pair is 55/5, but if I can create three of a kind, it jumps to 90/9 at level four, which is great!  

Mars might be the better choice since it aligns with achieving four of a kind. However, I need to remember how mixing suits affects how Ancients trigger. Ultimately, it looks like I should lean toward flushes because they maximize scoring. So, choosing planets like Earth or Mars needs careful consideration regarding what hand types I'll aim for!
**Choosing hand types**

I’m realizing that a full house can only use up to two clubs since it consists of three of one rank and two of another. With Splash not allowing extras for a full house, the synergy just isn’t there. The same goes for four of a kind, where I can have a maximum of two clubs. However, four of a kind offers a high base score, especially with the boost from Mars. So, I’ll go ahead and select Mars for this strategy.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.
